result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted for purposes of work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
Second half may be served on home monitor if Defendant qualifies after the assessment.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA Surcharges, and Domestic Abuse surcharges.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Complete and pay for Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program.
Write a letter of apology  to the victim Cori Ford.
No abusive contact with Cori Ford.
Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the agent, may include parenting class if the agent feels it is appropriate.
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel M Ford

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel M Ford in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:50 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 2 and Count 4. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated, this is a joint recommendation.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 4

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Lloyd  for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Court takes a moment to re-review the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: False Imprisonment
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Disorderly Conduct

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lloyd makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court finds the plea agreement fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 210 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for purposes of work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Second half may be served on home monitor if Defendant qualifies after the assessment
1 Day Jail Credit
Probation for a period of 3 Years
Conditions:
Provide a DNA sample
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Court Costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge, $100
Complete and pay for Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program
Write a letter of apology  to the victim Cori Ford
No abusive contact with Cori Ford
Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the agent, may include parenting class if the agent feels it is appropriate

Count 4:
Jail sentence for 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for purposes of work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Second half may be served on home monitor if Defendant qualifies after the assessment
1 Day Jail Credit
Probation for  a period of 1 Year, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay Court Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

Atty Kuhl addresses the Court regarding concurrent or consecutive. 
Court replies, depends if the probation gets revoked or not, determines how jail sentence will be handled.
Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

3:22 p.m. Defendant Daniel M Ford in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel M Ford in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
